description: Borrowed from Latin vidēlicet, which itself is a contraction of vidēre licet, meaning "it is permitted to see".

entries.meaning: Namely, to wit, that is to say (used when clarifying or naming the preceding item or topic)
examples: My father did speak much of the day he was not speedily to forget, videlicet May Day of 1517, when there was great apprentice rioting against insolent foreigners.
